clusters.title: Zelenskyy talks with allies on peace plan as Trump sets Thanksgiving deadline
clusters.neutral_headline: Zelenskyy Faces Pressure Amid Trump's Ukraine Peace Plan

items.title: Zelenskyy talks with allies on peace plan as Trump sets Thanksgiving deadline
items.standfirst: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy says U.S. peace plan forces Ukraine to choose between losing "dignity" or "a key partner."
items.content: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy says U.S. peace plan forces Ukraine to choose between losing "dignity" or "a key partner."

items.title: Zelenskyy faces pressure from Trump to accept his Ukraine peace plan
items.standfirst: President Trump said he’d like to see Ukraine accept his peace plan by Thursday of next week. But the plan asks Ukraine to make concessions it's previously rejected, and President Zelenskyy said his country has to decide whether to lose a major partner, or lose what it's been fighting for.…
items.content: President Trump said he’d like to see Ukraine accept his peace plan by Thursday of next week. But the plan asks Ukraine to make concessions it's previously rejected, and President Zelenskyy said his country has to decide whether to lose a major partner, or lose what it's been fighting for.…

items.title: Trump’s new Thanksgiving deadline for Ukraine peace plan
items.standfirst: President Trump said Ukraine had a Thursday deadline to give an answer on his new 28-point peace plan to end the war in Ukraine. NBC News’ Keir Simmons reports.
items.content: President Trump said Ukraine had a Thursday deadline to give an answer on his new 28-point peace plan to end the war in Ukraine. NBC News’ Keir Simmons reports.

items.title: Zelensky warns Ukraine risks losing US support over White House peace plan
items.standfirst: Vladimir Putin says the plan could be the "basis" for peace but warns Russia is prepared to fight on.
items.content: Vladimir Putin says the plan could be the "basis" for peace but warns Russia is prepared to fight on.

items.title: Zelenskyy says Ukraine has impossible choice as Trump pushes plan to end war
items.standfirst: US president demands that Kyiv accepts plan that would mean giving up territory to Russia Volodymyr Zelenskyy has said Ukraine faces one of the most difficult moments in its history, after Donald Trump demanded Kyiv accepts within days a US-backed “peace plan” that would force it to give up territory to Russia and make other painful concessions.Trump confirmed on Friday morning that next Thursday – Thanksgiving in the US – would be an “acceptable” deadline for Zelenskyy to sign the deal, which European and Ukrainian officials have said amounts to a “capitulation”. Continue reading...
items.content: US president demands that Kyiv accepts plan that would mean giving up territory to Russia Volodymyr Zelenskyy has said Ukraine faces one of the most difficult moments in its history, after Donald Trump demanded Kyiv accepts within days a US-backed “peace plan” that would force it to give up territory to Russia and make other painful concessions.Trump confirmed on Friday morning that next Thursday – Thanksgiving in the US – would be an “acceptable” deadline for Zelenskyy to sign the deal, which European and Ukrainian officials have said amounts to a “capitulation”. Continue reading...

items.title: Trump says Ukraine will have to accept peace plan - but critics warn it has 'real problems'
items.standfirst: Donald Trump has said Volodymyr Zelenskyy will have to approve a proposed peace plan to end the war in Ukraine.
items.content: Donald Trump has said Volodymyr Zelenskyy will have to approve a proposed peace plan to end the war in Ukraine.

items.content: President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said Ukraine faces one of its most difficult moments as it weighs a US peace proposal.

items.title: Putin says U.S. plan for Ukraine could form the basis for a final peace settlement
items.standfirst: The plan includes many of Russian President Vladimir Putin's demands. Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said Friday that his country is at "truly one of the most difficult moments in our history."
items.content: The plan includes many of Russian President Vladimir Putin's demands. Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said Friday that his country is at "truly one of the most difficult moments in our history."(Image credit: Kateryna Klochko)

items.title: How key players reacted to US plan to end war in Ukraine
items.standfirst: European leaders and UN officials voiced unease on Friday over a new US proposal to end the war in Ukraine, warning that Washington’s plan risked sidelining Kyiv and its allies. The 28-point plan calls for major concessions by Ukraine, including giving up a part of its eastern territory.
items.content: European leaders and UN officials voiced unease on Friday over a new US proposal to end the war in Ukraine, warning that Washington’s plan risked sidelining Kyiv and its allies. The 28-point plan calls for major concessions by Ukraine, including giving up a part of its eastern territory.

items.title: Volodymyr Zelensky faces an impossible dilemma for Ukraine
items.standfirst: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky is being pushed into a stark dilemma: accept the controversial US-backed peace plan — widely seen as overwhelmingly favourable to Russia — or risk being accused of rejecting peace and undermining Washington’s diplomatic efforts. President Donald Trump is now increasing pressure on Zelensky to endorse the proposal, leaving Kyiv with little room to manoeuvre, as FRANCE 24's Gulliver Cragg explains from Kyiv.
items.content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky is being pushed into a stark dilemma: accept the controversial US-backed peace plan — widely seen as overwhelmingly favourable to Russia — or risk being accused of rejecting peace and undermining Washington’s diplomatic efforts. President Donald Trump is now increasing pressure on Zelensky to endorse the proposal, leaving Kyiv with little room to manoeuvre, as FRANCE 24's Gulliver Cragg explains from Kyiv.

items.title: Ukraine risks ‘losing a key partner’ with Trump’s peace proposal, Zelensky says
items.standfirst: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said Friday that he would not betray Ukraine's interests in a US-led peace process, warning that Kyiv faces a choice between safeguarding its dignity and risking a rupture with Washington. The 28-point plan the United States presented to Kyiv was laden with Russian demands, including Ukrainian territorial concessions.
items.content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said Friday that he would not betray Ukraine's interests in a US-led peace process, warning that Kyiv faces a choice between safeguarding its dignity and risking a rupture with Washington. The 28-point plan the United States presented to Kyiv was laden with Russian demands, including Ukrainian territorial concessions.

items.title: Zelenskyy says Kyiv faces ‘difficult choice’ as Trump pushes for end to war
items.standfirst: Ukraine's president says country risks 'losing dignity or a major partner' as US plan offers key concessions to Russia.
items.content: Ukraine's president says country risks 'losing dignity or a major partner' as US plan offers key concessions to Russia.

items.title: White House urges Ukraine to accept peace plan as Zelenskyy weighs repercussions
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump said Friday that he wants Ukraine to accept a new peace deal by Thanksgiving, after Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy warned the deal was forcing his country to choose between its “dignity” and a “key partner.”The White House wants Kyiv to sign off on a “framework” to end the war in Ukraine based upon the U.S.-crafted 28-point peace plan by Thursday, according to three U.S. officials
items.content: President Donald Trump said Friday that he wants Ukraine to accept a new peace deal by Thanksgiving, after Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy warned the deal was forcing his country to choose between its “dignity” and a “key partner.”The White House wants Kyiv to sign off on a “framework” to end the war in Ukraine based upon the U.S.-crafted 28-point peace plan by Thursday, according to three U.S. officials

ai_summary: Zelenskyy says Trump's plan forces Ukraine to choose between dignity and a key partner.
Trump wants Ukraine to accept his peace plan by the upcoming Thursday deadline.
The plan demands concessions Ukraine has previously rejected, according to reports.
Zelenskyy warns Ukraine risks losing US support over the White House peace plan.
Putin suggests the plan could be a "basis" for peace but is prepared to fight on.

clusters.title: Trump calls Marjorie Taylor Greene resignation ‘great news for the country’
clusters.neutral_headline: Marjorie Taylor Greene to Resign from Congress

items.title: Trump calls Marjorie Taylor Greene resignation ‘great news for the country’
items.standfirst: President says ‘I think she should be happy’ while Democratic colleague praises her for stance on Epstein filesMarjorie Taylor Greene, the Republican Georgia congresswoman who had a dramatic blow-up with Donald Trump despite being his longtime ally, announced on Friday she would be resigning – which Trump called “great news”.“Loyalty should be a two-way street” while Congress “has mostly been sidelined” under the Trump administration, Greene said in a lengthy resignation statement on social media. Continue reading...
items.content: President says ‘I think she should be happy’ while Democratic colleague praises her for stance on Epstein filesMarjorie Taylor Greene, the Republican Georgia congresswoman who had a dramatic blow-up with Donald Trump despite being his longtime ally, announced on Friday she would be resigning – which Trump called “great news”.“Loyalty should be a two-way street” while Congress “has mostly been sidelined” under the Trump administration, Greene said in a lengthy resignation statement on social media. Continue reading...

items.title: From staunch Trump ally to ‘traitor’: key takeaways of Marjorie Taylor Greene’s career
items.standfirst: The Georgia representative said on Friday she was resigning from office effective January 2026Georgia congresswoman Marjorie Taylor Greene is used to delivering shocks to American politics, mainly to her Democratic and liberal opponents who have long seen her as a rightwing firebrand, but latterly to her own side as she rebelled against Donald Trump over the release of the Jeffrey Epstein files.Her dramatic announcement of her resignation on Friday was a typical act: out of the blue, full of punchy language and rage and – mostly – unexpected by people on both sides of the political aisle. Continue reading...
items.content: The Georgia representative said on Friday she was resigning from office effective January 2026Georgia congresswoman Marjorie Taylor Greene is used to delivering shocks to American politics, mainly to her Democratic and liberal opponents who have long seen her as a rightwing firebrand, but latterly to her own side as she rebelled against Donald Trump over the release of the Jeffrey Epstein files.Her dramatic announcement of her resignation on Friday was a typical act: out of the blue, full of punchy language and rage and – mostly – unexpected by people on both sides of the political aisle. Continue reading...

items.title: The stakes behind Zohran Mamdani and Donald Trump’s first face-to-face
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump is about to meet New York mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani on Friday, their first face-to-face after trading insults for weeks. Mamdani requested the meeting to discuss living costs and public safety, while Trump has threatened to cut federal funding to the city and branded the 34-year-old democratic socialist a 'radical left lunatic'. FRANCE 24's international editor Douglas Herbert analyses the stakes of this first meeting.
items.content: President Donald Trump is about to meet New York mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani on Friday, their first face-to-face after trading insults for weeks. Mamdani requested the meeting to discuss living costs and public safety, while Trump has threatened to cut federal funding to the city and branded the 34-year-old democratic socialist a 'radical left lunatic'. FRANCE 24's international editor Douglas Herbert analyses the stakes of this first meeting.

items.title: CDC claims vaccines may cause autism. And, Trump and Mamdani to meet today
items.standfirst: The CDC claims, without evidence, that vaccines may cause autism. And, New York City mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani heads to the White House, where he will meet the president for the first time.
items.content: The CDC claims, without evidence, that vaccines may cause autism. And, New York City mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani heads to the White House, where he will meet the president for the first time.(Image credit: Elijah Nouvelage)

ai_summary: President Trump and NYC Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani met at the White House.

The meeting was surprisingly cordial despite their past disagreements.
Trump and Mamdani discussed their shared goals for New York City.
Merriam-Webster released its first hardcover book in twenty-two years.

items.title: Nigerian Gunmen Abduct Over 200 Christian Children, 12 Teachers In Boarding School Attack

items.title: Nigeria reels after 215 children taken in second mass school abduction in a week
items.standfirst: Twelve teachers also kidnapped from Catholic school amid threats from Trump to intervene over ‘Christian genocide’Unknown gunmen have abducted 215 schoolchildren and 12 teachers from a Catholic school in central Nigeria, the second mass abduction in the country in a week.The latest kidnapping, in Papiri community in Niger state, came against the backdrop of Donald Trump’s threat to intervene militarily to end a “Christian genocide”, which the Nigerian government has denied is happening. Continue reading...

items.title: US data agency cancels October inflation report as Fed considers whether to cut rates
items.standfirst: Bureau of Labor Statistics canceled release of October’s consumer price index, citing the government shutdownThe US federal government will not publish official data on inflation for October, depriving policymakers at the Federal Reserve of key information as they consider whether to cut interest rates.The Bureau of Labor Statistics canceled the release of the closely watched consumer price index (CPI) for October, citing the government shutdown – the longest in history, before it ended earlier this month – and stating it could not “retroactively collect” the data required for the report. Continue reading...
